events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Tottenham Hotspur

headlines.description: Tottenham bounced back from their loss to Chelsea by coming from behind to defeat Brighton on Boxing Day.
headlines.shortLinkText: Kane, Alli seal Spurs comeback vs. Brighton

headlines.description: Arsenal came from behind to earn a 1-1 draw at Bournemouth in Mikel Arteta's first match in charge of the club.
headlines.shortLinkText: Arsenal earn comeback draw on Arteta bow

headlines.description: Aston Villa midfielder Conor Hourihane gave his side a 1-0 home win over Norwich City to move them one step closer to safety in the Premier League o
headlines.shortLinkText: Villa deal Norwich Boxing Day blow with 1-0 win in relegation

headlines.description: Chelsea suffered more woe at Stamford Bridge after losing 2-0 to Southampton on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea's home woes continue after Saints loss

events.name: West Ham United at Crystal Palace

headlines.description: Jordan Ayew's magnificent late solo goal earned Crystal Palace a 2-1 come-from-behind home win against West Ham United.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ayew magic seals win for Palace over West Ham

headlines.description: Carlo Ancelotti enjoyed a winning start as Everton manager with an 80th-minute Dominic Calvert-Lewin header earning a 1-0 win over Burnley.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ancelotti off to fine start as Everton beat Burnley

headlines.description: Watford moved off the bottom of the Premier League after a spirited performance earned them a 1-1 draw at Sheffield United on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Battling Watford hold Sheffield United to 1-1 draw

headlines.description: Manchester United stormed back to defeat Newcastle United 4-1 in Premier League play at Old Trafford on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man Utd storm past Newcastle after early deficit

headlines.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold had one goal and two assists as Liverpool secured a 4-0 win over Leicester City and increased their Premier League lead.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool pad Prem lead with 4-0 win at Leicester
